enko.commentary:
Considerat obsolet per l'autor: 
"mi pali e nimi enko a a
open la pilin mi li sama
nimi enko li pona, jan mute o kepeken
taso kepeken pi toki pona la mi kama sona
nimi ante li ken toki e wile toki pi nimi enko
la ona li suli ala"

ja.commentary: Can also be combined with lo to mark modified or compound prepositions, marking the end of a preposition marked by lo and the start of the prepositional object.

jans.commentary: Not coined directly, but developed out of repeated use in the early ma pona pi toki pona Discord server community. jans was repeatedly used because of the humor in adding an English plural suffix to a Toki Pona word.

jepi.commentary: Coined indepentently multiple times over several years, non-wuwojiti variant of the word jipi.

jipi.commentary: Coined indepentently multiple times over several years.

jonke.commentary: Coined in reference to the Untitled Goose Game fandom.

josuta.commentary: josuta is not the same as ko. or kiwen. or telo. It is its own thing. josuta covers the concepts of elasticity, the quality of things that are rubbery, and stretchy; elasticity. This is not to be confused with ko. josuta is a seperate thing, that is, in any way, not covered by "ko", "telo", "kiwen", or "suwi".

ju.definition: (paraula reservada per a √∫s futur per Sonja Lang)

jule.etymology: Êè∫„Çå„Çã (yureru): Japanese, shake, vibrate, oscillate, waver

jume.commentary: Experimental, to see how the meaning could be expanded, but never actually used. No set of meanings was ever settled on before stopping the experiment, but one potential meaning the creator particularly liked was "fantasy" or "unreality", without a negative connotation.

jupi.commentary: Coined indepentently multiple times over several years. Non-wuwojiti variant of the word jipi that has mostly overtaken it in use.

jupi.etymology: yupi: Spanish, yippee; yippee: English, yippee; .ui: Lojban, happiness

ka.definition: (substitut de "li", marcat per a temps futur)
ka.etymology: ka: toki sapin, (future tense marker); kama: toki pona, coming

ka1.commentary:
Recoined indepentently multiple times over several years."
Originally created for toki sapin, a short-lived unfinished tokiponido created in January 2021 by jan Posuke. It survived through notes in ma pona pi toki pona, where it was the first thing that came up for "ka".
Created as part of a set with "so" for the past tense, "te" for the present tense, and contractions "miso", "mite", and "mika". Only "ka" has seen significant mention outside of toki sapin.

ka2.commentary: Borrowed from tuki tiki as a replacement for the deprecated konwe.
ka2.definition: living thing, moving being, creature; life, alive
ka2.etymology: ka: tuki tiki, being, person, creature, alive; jan: toki pona, human being, person, somebody

kalamARR.etymology: kalama: toki pona, make sound. sound, noise, voice; arr: English, (imitation of pirates)

kalapisituji.commentary: the orthography of that word is not fixed and any ‚Äúwuwojiti‚Äù is not considered a mistake. In fact, basically anything after kalapis‚Ä¶ can be altered and it would still be considered the same word (so go ahead and have fun with kalapisituwi, kalapisituje, kalapisu‚Ä¶, or any form that pleases you).

kan.definition: (preposici√≥) amb, entre, al costat de, en companyia de

kana.commentary: Serves as a non-deprecated, neutral-connotation, and polysemous variant of words like oni, powe, or jume.

kankuli.etymology: scrunkly: English, cute in a quirky, scruffy, or dishevelled way

kapa.commentary: In a poll in 2002, "kapa" was proposed as a replacement for "nena". However, it failed to get enough votes.

kese.etymology: ◊ß÷∂◊©÷∂◊Å◊™ (k√©≈°et): Hebrew, named for the Jewish LGBT organization Keshet

kewe.commentary: Part of a system with sunta to express the colors seen by someone with tritanopia (blue-yellow colorblindness).

ki.commentary: Provides relativisation of subjects (see WALS 122A), but not relativisation of obliques (see WALS 123A). Unlike ki, more typical relative constructions (usually two clauses linked via ni) support both.

kokoliko.definition: gall, gallina, ocells del g√®nere Gallus

kolin.etymology: ko olin: toki pona, amor llefisc√≥s

konsi.commentary: Virtually unknown outside the Korean toki pona community. Apparently used humorously.

kosan.definition: guardar, protegir, defensar, escudar, afermar-se, fortificar des de fora

kosikosa.definition: m√©s o menys / mitj√† / una mica semblant

kulaso.etymology: green: English, green; laso: toki pona, blue, green

kutopoma.etymology: kulupu pi toki pona pi ma Anku: toki pona, the Toki Pona community of Korea

lan.commentary: Intended as a replacement for 'jan' in mixed-headnoun groups, or when the headnoun of the person being referred to is unknown.

lisa.commentary: Coined in response to -isa animal words.

lo.commentary: Previously known as lu. Most of those interested in the word have agreed to change it to lo, to avoid interfering with the reserved word. Can also be combined with ja to mark modified or compound prepositions, with ja marking the end of a preposition marked by lo and the start of the prepositional object.

lu.definition: (paraula reservada per a √∫s futur per Sonja Lang)

lu1.etymology: alu: toki pona, (indicate context for a prior sentence)

natu.etymology: ng√£ t∆∞: Vietnamese, crossroads, four-way intersection

nele.commentary: Meant to be antonymous to the 'cover, layer of privacy' meanings of 'len'. It can be applied both literally and metaphorically.

nele.etymology: len: toki pona, cloth, fabric, clothing. secret, hidden, covered

nowi.commentary: Intended as an alt to esun which implies that non-mutually-beneficial relationships are not real relationships.
nowi.definition: connectat, relacionat, unit; complementari, mutu; intercanviar
nowi.etymology: n·ªëi: Vietnamese, to join, to add, to unite, to connect. to continue, to carry on, to perpetuate

nu.definition: (paraula reservada per a √∫s futur per Sonja Lang)

okepuma.definition: boomer, Baby Boomer, persona vella amb poca consideraci√≥; [interjecci√≥/insult]

oki.commentary: Though it may have many possible origins, it was first coined in a small group chat. It is mostly used as a variant of the toki pona words "oke" and "ke"
oki.etymology: okie: English, okay; okay: English, okay

olala.commentary: this is a hard word to explain and you've got to use it right. It's pretty much linked to anything you could use "oh l√†  l√†" or "ouh l√† l√†" for. But because it's now a full-fledged toki pona content word, it got even more powerful and versatile. It can be used for joy, surprise, excitement, admiration, compassion, empathy, sadness, disappointment, and even to show you‚Äôre interested in someone romantically. However, it's equally important (or more) to know when to *not* use the word, you wouldn‚Äôt want to commit a faux-pas!

omekalike.definition: (nom propi) una can√ß√≥ de jan Usawi, (literalment) "o moku e kala ike" (menja un peix dolent)
omekalike.etymology: o moku e kala ike: toki pona, 'eat a bad fish', wishing somebody harm instead of well; o moku e kala pona: toki pona, 'eat a good fish', wishing somebody well

omen.commentary: Originally an initialism of "o moli e mi" ("omem"); compare the formations of "peto" and "kuntu".
omen.etymology: o moli e mi: toki pona, 'kill me', express exasperation or frustration sarcastically

oni.commentary:
This word is deprecated by the creator; it is considered part of the "toki oni" tokiponido instead.
The pronunciation of the second syllable was due to personal preferences of the creator, not modern Greek.
oni.definition: somni, fantasia, somiar truites, visi√≥, estat m√≠stic; fer entrar en tr√†nsit

pa.definition: (interjecci√≥) com l'angl√®s "bruh", expressa incredulitat, exasperaci√≥ o emoci√≥

pakola.etymology: pakala: toki pona, broken, damaged, harmed, destroyed

panke.definition: pan palisa Panke (baguet); quelcom t√≠pic de la cultura francesa; en parlar el toki pona calcar el franc√®s

papa.definition: Baba, el personatge del joc "Baba is You"

papa1.definition: objecte d'iridi que gira i accelera exponencialment

papa2.commentary: Several (different?) people in 2019-2021 weirdly kept putting "papa" in their Reddit / Facebook posts, seemingly to promote it as a word to other people. It caused a backlash, with other people criticising the coinage, and coining other meanings for "papa".

pasila.definition: bo, f√†cil; simple, relaxat, pac√≠fic, poc complicat
pasila.etymology: facile: Acadian French, easy; facila: Esperanto, easy

pata.etymology: –±—Ä–∞—Ç (brat): Serbo-Croatian, brother; brata: Tok Pisin, sibling or cousin of the same gender; brother: English, brother

pela.commentary: A reference to Sacha Baron Cohen's interview with Noah Chomsky.

peta.definition: verd, verd√≥s; exuberant, frond√≥s, viu; ecol√≤gic, bo per al medi ambient

peto.commentary: Originally an initialism of "pana e telo oko"; compare the formations of "omen" and "kuntu".
peto.etymology: pana e telo oko: toki pona, (incomplete sentence) 'give eye-water', to cry

pipo.etymology: pipi: toki pona, bug, insect, arachnid

pipolo.definition: quelcom que suposadament √©s "kikolo" per√≤ no ho √©s
pipolo.etymology: kikolo: toki pona; pipo: toki pona

pokasi.definition: poggies, pog, poggers (interjection indicating excitement); epic, cool, amazing, exciting

pomotolo.commentary: From the time management method developed by Francesco Cirillo in Berlin in the 1980s, for which people often used tomato-shaped timers. In ku, "pomotolo" was given as one of the translations of "tomato", presumably due to speakers misusing or misunderstanding the word.

poni.commentary: Occasionally comes up as a jokish corruption of "pona" (especially in a phrase "toki poni").
poni.definition: poni (o quelcom relatiu a la franqu√≠cia "My Little Pony")

positu.definition: la vida, l'univers, i tota la resta de coses

pulaso.definition: blau, blav√≥s, indi, blau mar√≠, atzur, blau d'ultramar
pulaso.etymology: blue: English, blue; laso: toki pona, blue, green

salu.commentary: üí≠ Intended as an experiment in its current form, and is not meant for widespread use at this time. Meant to be used alongside a nasin that does not use either ike or pona to express value judgements (especially morality). These words are often used in a way that ignores the reasoning behind the judgement. The goal of this experimental nasin is to promote mindfulness about value itself, translating mere reaction into introspection and explanation. ‚ö†Ô∏è Because of the stated attachment to this particular nasin pi toki pona, it should be noted that using salu and pona/ike as good/bad at the same time goes against the point of the word's creation, and that salu is redundant in this circumstance. If you are using one, you should not use the other.
salu.definition: confort, seguretat, estabilitat; atenci√≥, cura, precauci√≥

samu.commentary: Coined in reference to jan Samu, a Facebook user who attempted to propose a new word.
samu.etymology: jan Samu: toki pona, jan Samu

sikako.commentary: sikeko is a common misspelling from tokiponists who believe "sikako" derives from "sike ko".

sikomo.commentary: Coined in reference to the Travis Scott song ‚ÄòSicko Mode‚Äô.
sikomo.definition: en un pla superior, il¬∑luminar/il¬∑luminat, √®pic, fins a un punt excedentment gran

silapa.commentary:
Customarily written on multiple lines with a long "neck" composed of the letter "i" (originally the first "a"), like so:
si
 i
 ilapa

sipi.commentary: Proposed on a forum and quickly forgotten. Notable only for being an early non pu word proposal.
sipi.etymology: sibi (dative reflexive pronoun): Latin, sibi (dative reflexive pronoun)

sipije.etymology: TBH creature: English; TBH: English, to be honest

siwala.definition: la qualitat de no ser comprensible per√≤ acceptat aix√≠ i tot com a realitat; la qualitat de no voler ser ent√®s per alg√∫ pels beneficis associats amb no entendre
siwala.etymology: tiwal√†: Tagalog, trust. faith (in someone or something). reliance, confidence, belief

slape.etymology: lape: toki pona, sleep, rest; sleep: English, sleep

snoweli.commentary: Originally a sitelen pona glyph with no definition, created for fun and submitted to linja lipamanka. It grew popular after its inclusion in the font "sitelen seli kiwen", after which it has come to have a definition and seen some use.
snoweli.definition: soweli with relation to the snow or cold, soweli living in predominantly cold or snowy environments (often light-colored); arctic fox
snoweli.etymology: snowman: English, snowman; soweli: toki pona, fuzzy creature, land animal, beast

sole.commentary: May refer to a state prior to a kama.
sole.definition: patr√≥, constant, que no ha canviat, immutable, no afectat, invariable; instint, h√†bit, soler, tendir a
sole.etymology: soler: Spanish, to use to, to tend to

su1.definition: [marcador de preguntes de s√≠ o no, substituint el rol de "li"]

suke.commentary: The typo was made by jan Sonja while writing ku. The absolute majority of the community does not treat it as a newly coined word.
suke.etymology: typo of sike: toki pona, circle, sphere, cycle

sulaso.definition: cian, turquesa, atzur, celeste, blau cel, blau clar, color clar blav√≥s
sulaso.etymology: cyan: English, the color between blue and green on the visible spectrum of light; laso: toki pona, blue, green

sunta.commentary: Part of a system with kewe to express the colors seen by someone with tritanopia (blue-yellow colorblindness).
sunta.etymology: suno: toki pona, light, shine, glow, radiance. sun, light source. brightness; uta: toki pona, mouth, lips, throat, consuming orifice

suwili.etymology: soweli: toki pona; suwi: toki pona

ta.commentary: Follows a semantically consistent pattern of "SUBJ li PV ta PRED" = "SUBJ li PV e [SUBJ li PRED]" or "[SUBJ li PRED] li PV". The top and bottom lines of the sitelen pona may be extended to the left around the pre-predicate word(s).
ta.definition: (part√≠cula) [marca les paraules anteriors com a preverbs]

tankala.commentary: One-off coinage by Sonja Lang after asking about neologisms for directions.

tasun.commentary: Coined as a challenge to font creators. The sitelen pona glyph can be extended horizontally. This is usually represented in Latin characters by additional a's, e.g. "taaasun".

teki.definition: cas, circumst√†ncia, situaci√≥, esdeveniment, estat (de la situaci√≥, f√≠sic, mental), estatus

ten.etymology: tenpo: toki pona, time, event, situation

tenkala.commentary: Variant of tankala, suggested at the same time as an alternate tokiponization of the etymon.

tokana.definition: concentraci√≥, atenci√≥, concentrar, determinaci√≥, resoluci√≥, finesa; concentrar-se en

toma.commentary: The typo was made by jan Sonja while writing ku. The absolute majority of the community does not treat it as a newly coined word.
toma.etymology: typo of tomo: toki pona, home, room, house, building

tona.commentary: This word was only coined to make the spoonerism "poki tona" have a meaning.

towoki.definition: "howa" (hola dit amb la mena de parlar "owo" popularitzada a internet)
towoki.etymology: toki: toki pona, hello; OwO: emoticon, cat-like surprised face

u.definition: (paraula reservada per a √∫s futur per Sonja Lang)

uka.commentary: Part of a system with kelo to express the colors seen by someone with protanopia or deuteranopia (red-green colorblindness).
uka.etymology: uta: toki pona, mouth, lips, throat, consuming orifice; kasi: toki pona, plant, vegetation. herb, leaf

umesu.commentary: Created for the game Acrophobia (musi Ako) in response to the fact that there are few words starting with 'u' in Toki Pona.
umesu.definition: Deixar bocabadada la gent estant a dalt d'un r√†nquing d'un joc de toki pona
umesu.etymology: Umeyz: Iqglic, to amaze (someone), surprise, impress

waken.etymology: wuggen: English, non-standard plural of "wug"; wug: English, imaginary creature resembling a bird

waleja.commentary: May be used as a preposition, e.g. "lipu waleja toki pona = a book about toki pona". However, this usage is very rare.
waleja.definition: context, tema, rellev√†ncia, pertinent, t√≤pic, pert√†nyer a, ser rellevant
waleja.etymology: valdea: Quenya, of moment, important; valda: Quenya, worth, worthy, dear

wawajete.commentary: Coined in reference to wuwojiti, a sequence of all phonotactically unviable CV syllables in toki pona.
wawajete.definition: quelcom que sembla que trenca les normes per√≤ no ho fa; falsa altivesa, provocaci√≥
wawajete.etymology: wuwojiti: toki pona, (all the phonotactically unviable CV syllables in Toki Pona)

we1.definition: (actua com a transici√≥ d'una oraci√≥ sencera a una altra)
we1.etymology: g√ºey: Spanish, man; man: English, man (sentence tag)

wi.definition: nosaltres (inclou el parlant i altra gent i exclou la persona a qui parla)

wiwi.definition: si √©s clar!, estar d'acord (fortament), consentir, aprovar

yutu.commentary: The "y" was a typo and was meant to be "j", but got kept in anyway; compare "yupekosi".
yutu.definition: l'emoji d'estrella fet servir per al canal de recopilaci√≥ de favorits #pona-kulupu al servidor de Discord "ma pona pi toki pona"
